sentence.Network_en: Have done with your foolish sophism.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... sophist n 博学之人；诡辩家 sophism n 诡辩 sophisticate v 使精致；使老于世故.

list.abs: 当你回去时，你将不单只是一个知道如何回应辩士学派（sophismes）的人，或在讨论中让人称羡的人。你应该像一个疼痛被减轻、被 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French sophime, via Latin from Greek sophisma 'clever device', from sophizesthai 'become wise' (see sophist)

means.word_mean: 1. a deliberately invalid argument displaying ingenuity in reasoning in the hope of deceiving someone

auth_sentence.content: It's easy to catch Sophism if you already know a person's agenda.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's easy to catch Sophism if you already know a person's agenda.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's easy to catch Sophism if you already know a person's agenda.

auth_sentence.content: Nothing in creationism has satisfactorally explained anything whatsoever, except by resorting to sophism.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nothing in creationism has satisfactorally explained anything whatsoever, except by resorting to sophism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nothing in creationism has satisfactorally explained anything whatsoever, except by resorting to sophism.
